name: 2-{[(pyridin-2-ylamino)methyl]amino}naphthalene-1,4-dione
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1906
Reason: 2-Amino-1,4-naphthalenedione has a melting point of 140°C. The pyridine ring in the molecule contributes to the melting point, as it is a rigid and planar structure that can form hydrogen bonds with other molecules, which increases the melting point by approximately +20°C. The methyl group attached to the pyridine ring also adds a small contribution to the melting point, estimated at around +5°C. The naphthalene ring itself has a melting point of around 100°C, which is relatively rigid and planar, and the carbonyl group adds a small contribution to the melting point, estimated at around +10°C.
